page.title: 02POPULATION AND LIFESTYLES
page.content: The general Population (pop.) of the area of Leconfield has changed gradually over the years and has greatly increased since the opening of the airfield in 1936 which had ceased its operational status in 1965 but was used intermittently up until 1976. There were 192 poll-tax payers in 1377.In 1672 there were 66 Households in the two settlements 16 of them exempt from the hearth tax; 50 had a single hearth each, 11 had 2, 3 had 3 or 4, 1 had 5 and 1 had 6. In 1743 there were 50 families, the pop. in 1851 was 362, in 1901 it was 347 which dropped to 283 in 1931 possibly due to the deaths caused by the First World War (1914/18). In 1961 the pop. was 1412 and currently there are just over 2000 inhabitants of the village. Many more come to work at the Army School of Mechanical Transport.
